intro: Asphodelus ramosus var. africanus, commonly known as the African asphodel, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features linear, grass-like leaves and produces tall, branched inflorescences with small, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy choice for xeriscaping. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value in native habitats.
